publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1925# Ms Sandra White: European Year of Languages and BSL—That the Parliament believes that in 2001, the European Year of Languages, the Scottish Executive should take forward the lessons of the Millennium Project 2000 which taught the basics of British Sign Language (BSL) and Deaf Awareness to schoolchildren; invites the Scottish Executive to investigate the introduction of BSL to the school curriculum, and further believes that Her Majesty’s Government should give official recognition to BSL under the terms of the European Charter on Minority Languages.

S1M-1925# Ms Sandra White: European Year of Languages and BSL—That the Parliament believes that in 2001, the European Year of Languages, the Scottish Executive should take forward the lessons of the Millennium Project 2000 which taught the basics of British Sign Language (BSL) and Deaf Awareness to schoolchildren; invites the Scottish Executive to investigate the introduction of BSL to the school curriculum, and further believes that Her Majesty’s Government should give official recognition to BSL under the terms of the European Charter on Minority Languages. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1925# European Year of Languages and BSL (lodged on 10 May 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1925# European Year of Languages and BSL (lodged on 10 May 2001) Linda Fabiani*, Andrew Wilson*, Alex Neil*
S1M-1925# European Year of Languages and BSL (lodged on 10 May 2001) Christine Grahame*
S1M-1925# European Year of Languages and BSL (lodged on 10 May 2001) Mrs Margaret Ewing*

S1M-1925# Ms Sandra White: European Year of Languages and BSL—That the Parliament believes that in 2001, the European Year of Languages, the Scottish Executive should take forward the lessons of the Millennium Project 2000 which taught the basics of British Sign Language (BSL) and Deaf Awareness to schoolchildren; invites the Scottish Executive to investigate the introduction of BSL to the school curriculum, and further believes that Her Majesty’s Government should give official recognition to BSL under the terms of the European Charter on Minority Languages. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Ms Margo MacDonald, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-1925# European Year of Languages and BSL (lodged on 10 May 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Fiona McLeod*
